headline: News Corp Shareholders Reject Activist Bid to End Dual-Class Share Structure
summary: Shareholders voted down Starboard Value’s proposal, which was aimed at damping the Murdoch family’s influence over the media conglomerate.

raw.headline: News Corp Shareholders Reject Activist Bid to End Dual-Class Share Structure
raw.summary: Shareholders voted down Starboard Value’s proposal, which was aimed at damping the Murdoch family’s influence over the media conglomerate.

headline: News Corp says investors reject proposal to end dual class voting structure
summary: News Corp said on Wednesday that investors rejected a proposal by activist investor Starboard Value to break the Murdoch family's grip on the publisher by ending a dual class voting structure. The company said the hedge fund's non-binding shareholder resolution fell short of securing the number of votes needed to pass at today's annual meeting. The Murdoch Family Trust owns more than 40% of the voting shares.

raw.headline: News Corp says investors reject proposal to end dual class voting structure
raw.summary: News Corp said on Wednesday that investors rejected a proposal by activist investor Starboard Value to break the Murdoch family's grip on the publisher by ending a dual class voting structure. The company said the hedge fund's non-binding shareholder resolution fell short of securing the number of votes needed to pass at today's annual meeting. The Murdoch Family Trust owns more than 40% of the voting shares.

headline: News Corp Statement Following the 2024 Annual Meeting of Stockholders
summary: NEW YORK, November 20, 2024--News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS; NWSLV) today announced that, at its Annual Meeting of Stockholders, stockholders overwhelmingly elected the company’s full slate of Directors and voted with the Board’s recommendations on all proposals, including convincingly defeating the non-binding proposal to adopt a recapitalization plan that would eliminate News Corp’s dual-class capital structure.
